intro: Lysimachia pentophylla, commonly known as the five-leaf sorrel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Primulaceae family. It is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. The plant has opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Lysimachia pentophylla is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
